actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.
Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.
Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported by Senator Biden with an amendment. With written report No. 107-125.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 293.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
The committee amendment agreed to by Unanimous Consent.
S. 1779 was advanced to third reading.
Senate incorporated this measure in H.R. 2998 as an amendment.
Senate passed companion measure H.R. 2998 in lieu of this measure by Unanimous Consent.
Returned to the Calendar. Calendar No. 293.
Indefinitely postponed by Senate by Unanimous Consent.

official_title: A bill to authorize the establishment of "Radio Free Afghanistan", and for other purposes.

summary.text: Radio Free Afghanistan Act - Requires RFE/RL, Incorporated (also known as Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty) to submit to the Broadcasting Board of Governors a detailed plan for the establishment of surrogate broadcasting services (Radio Free Afghanistan) in the Dari and Pashto languages to Afghanistan. Authorizes the Board to make grants to support Radio Free Afghanistan.Declares that Radio Free Afghanistan shall adhere to the same standards of professionalism and accountability and oversight mechanisms as other services of RFE/RL, Incorporated.Authorizes appropriations for FY 2002 for international broadcasting operations and broadcasting capital improvements for broadcasting into Afghanistan.Amends the Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Years 1994 and 1995 to repeal the ban on the use of U.S. funds to construct a U.S. radio transmitter in Kuwait.

titles.title: A bill to authorize the establishment of "Radio Free Afghanistan", and for other purposes.
